00011 class core_decode_STM_t:public core_decode_t
00012 {
00013   enum decode_stall_t {DSTALL_NONE,   /* no stall */
00014                        DSTALL_FULL,   /* first decode stage is full */
00015                        DSTALL_EMPTY,  /* no insts to decode */
00016                        DSTALL_TARGET, /* target correction flushed remaining insts (only occurs when target_stage == crack_stage-1) */
00017                        DSTALL_num
00018                       };
00019 
00020   public:
00021 
00022   /* constructor, stats registration */
00023   core_decode_STM_t(struct core_t * const core);
00024   virtual void reg_stats(struct stat_sdb_t * const sdb);
00025   virtual void update_occupancy(void);
00026 
00027   virtual void step(void);
00028   virtual void recover(void);
00029   virtual void recover(struct Mop_t * const Mop);
00030 
00031   /* interface functions for alloc stage */
00032   virtual bool uop_available(void);
00033   virtual struct uop_t * uop_peek(void);
00034   virtual void uop_consume(void);
00035 
00036   protected:
00037 
00038   struct Mop_t *** pipe; /* the actual decode pipe */
00039   int * occupancy;
00040 
00041   static const char * decode_stall_str[DSTALL_num];
00042 
00043   enum decode_stall_t check_target(struct Mop_t * const Mop);
00044   bool check_flush(const int stage, const int idx);
00045 };

00047 const char * core_decode_STM_t::decode_stall_str[DSTALL_num] = {
00048   "no stall                   ",
00049   "next decode stage is full  ",
00050   "no insts to decode         ",
00051   "target correction          ",
00052 };
00053 
00054 core_decode_STM_t::core_decode_STM_t(struct core_t * const arg_core)
00055 {
00056   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = arg_core->knobs;
00057   core = arg_core;
00058 
00059   if(knobs->decode.depth <= 0)
00060     fatal("decode pipe depth must be > 0");
00061 
00062   if((knobs->decode.width <= 0) || (knobs->decode.width > MAX_DECODE_WIDTH))
00063     fatal("decode pipe width must be > 0 and < %d (change MAX_DECODE_WIDTH if you want more)",MAX_DECODE_WIDTH);
00064 
00065   if(knobs->decode.target_stage <= 0 || knobs->decode.target_stage >= knobs->decode.depth)
00066     fatal("decode target resteer stage (%d) must be > 0, and less than decode pipe depth (currently set to %d)",knobs->decode.target_stage,knobs->decode.depth);
00067 
00068   /* if the pipe is N wide, we assume there are N decoders */
00069   pipe = (struct Mop_t***) calloc(knobs->decode.depth,sizeof(*pipe));
00070   if(!pipe)
00071     fatal("couldn't calloc decode pipe");
00072 
00073   for(int i=0;i<knobs->decode.depth;i++)
00074   {
00075     pipe[i] = (struct Mop_t**) calloc(knobs->decode.width,sizeof(**pipe));
00076     if(!pipe[i])
00077       fatal("couldn't calloc decode pipe stage");
00078   }
00079 
00080   occupancy = (int*) calloc(knobs->decode.depth,sizeof(*occupancy));
00081   if(!occupancy)
00082     fatal("couldn't calloc decode pipe occupancy array");
00083 
00084   if(knobs->decode.fusion_none)
00085     knobs->decode.fusion_mode = 0x00000000;
00086   else if(knobs->decode.fusion_all)
00087   {
00088     if(knobs->decode.fusion_all || knobs->decode.fusion_load_op || knobs->decode.fusion_sta_std || knobs->decode.fusion_partial)
00089       warnonce("uop fusion not supported in Simple Timing Model");
00090     knobs->decode.fusion_all = false;
00091     knobs->decode.fusion_load_op = false;
00092     knobs->decode.fusion_sta_std = false;
00093     knobs->decode.fusion_partial = false;
00094   }
00095 }

00097 void
00098 core_decode_STM_t::reg_stats(struct stat_sdb_t * const sdb)
00099 {
00100   char buf[1024];
00101   char buf2[1024];
00102   struct thread_t * arch = core->current_thread;
00103 
00104   stat_reg_note(sdb,"\n#### DECODE STATS ####");
00105   sprintf(buf,"c%d.target_resteers",arch->id);
00106   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, "decode-time target resteers", &core->stat.target_resteers, core->stat.target_resteers, NULL);
00107   sprintf(buf,"c%d.decode_insn",arch->id);
00108   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, "total number of instructions decodeed", &core->stat.decode_insn, core->stat.decode_insn, NULL);
00109   sprintf(buf,"c%d.decode_uops",arch->id);
00110   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, "total number of uops decodeed", &core->stat.decode_uops, core->stat.decode_uops, NULL);
00111   sprintf(buf,"c%d.decode_IPC",arch->id);
00112   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.decode_insn/c%d.sim_cycle",arch->id,arch->id);
00113   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "IPC at decode", buf2, NULL);
00114   sprintf(buf,"c%d.decode_uPC",arch->id);
00115   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.decode_uops/c%d.sim_cycle",arch->id,arch->id);
00116   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "uPC at decode", buf2, NULL);
00117 
00118   sprintf(buf,"c%d.decode_stall",core->current_thread->id);
00119   core->stat.decode_stall = stat_reg_dist(sdb, buf,
00120                                            "breakdown of stalls at decode",
00121                                            /* initial value */0,
00122                                            /* array size */DSTALL_num,
00123                                            /* bucket size */1,
00124                                            /* print format */(PF_COUNT|PF_PDF),
00125                                            /* format */NULL,
00126                                            /* index map */decode_stall_str,
00127                                            /* print fn */NULL);
00128   
00129 }

00135 /*************************/
00136 /* MAIN DECODE FUNCTIONS */

00139 /* Helper functions to check for BAC-related resteers */
00140 
00141 /* Check an individual Mop to see if it's next target is correct/reasonable, and
00142    recover if necessary. */
00143 enum core_decode_STM_t::decode_stall_t
00144 core_decode_STM_t::check_target(struct Mop_t * const Mop)
00145 {
00146   if(Mop->decode.is_ctrl)
00147   {
00148     if((Mop->fetch.pred_NPC != (Mop->fetch.PC + Mop->fetch.inst.len)) /* branch is predicted taken */
00149         || (Mop->decode.opflags | F_UNCOND))
00150     {
00151       if(Mop->fetch.pred_NPC != Mop->decode.targetPC) /* wrong target */
00152       {
00153         if(Mop->fetch.bpred_update)
00154           core->fetch->bpred->recover(Mop->fetch.bpred_update,/*taken*/1);
00155         ZESTO_STAT(core->stat.target_resteers++;)
00156         core->oracle->recover(Mop);
00157         recover(Mop);
00158         core->fetch->recover(Mop->decode.targetPC);
00159         Mop->fetch.pred_NPC = Mop->decode.targetPC;
00160         return DSTALL_TARGET;
00161       }
00162     }
00163   }
00164   return DSTALL_NONE;
00165 }
00166 
00167 /* Perform branch-address calculation check for a given decode-pipe stage
00168    and Mop position. */
00169 bool core_decode_STM_t::check_flush(const int stage, const int idx)
00170 {
00171   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
00172   /* stage-1 because we assume the following checks are acted upon only after
00173      the instruction has spent a cycle in the corresponding pipeline stage. */
00174   struct Mop_t * Mop = pipe[stage-1][idx];
00175   enum decode_stall_t stall_reason;
00176 
00177   if(Mop)
00178   {
00179     if((stage-1) == knobs->decode.target_stage)
00180     {
00181       if((stall_reason = check_target(Mop)))
00182       {
00183         pipe[stage][idx] = pipe[stage-1][idx];
00184         pipe[stage-1][idx] = NULL;
00185         if(pipe[stage][idx]) {
00186           occupancy[stage]++;
00187           occupancy[stage-1]--;
00188           zesto_assert(occupancy[stage] <= knobs->decode.width,false);
00189           zesto_assert(occupancy[stage-1] >= 0,false);
00190         }
00191         ZESTO_STAT(stat_add_sample(core->stat.decode_stall, (int)stall_reason);)
00192         return true;
00193       }
00194     }
00195   }
00196 
00197   return false;
00198 }
00199 
00200 
00201 /* shuffle Mops down the decode pipe, read Mops from fetch */
00202 void core_decode_STM_t::step(void)
00203 {
00204   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
00205   int stage, i;
00206   enum decode_stall_t stall_reason = DSTALL_NONE;
00207 
00208   /* walk pipe backwards up to and but not including the first stage*/
00209   for(stage=knobs->decode.depth-1; stage > 0; stage--)
00210   {
00211     if(0 == occupancy[stage]) /* implementing non-serpentine pipe (no compressing) - can't advance until stage is empty */
00212     {
00213       zesto_assert(occupancy[stage] == 0,(void)0);
00214 
00215       /* move everyone from previous stage forward */
00216       if(occupancy[stage-1])
00217         for(i=0;i<knobs->decode.width;i++)
00218         {
00219           if(check_flush(stage,i))
00220             return;
00221 
00222           pipe[stage][i] = pipe[stage-1][i];
00223           pipe[stage-1][i] = NULL;
00224           if(pipe[stage][i]) {
00225             occupancy[stage]++;
00226             occupancy[stage-1]--;
00227             zesto_assert(occupancy[stage] <= knobs->decode.width,(void)0);
00228             zesto_assert(occupancy[stage-1] >= 0,(void)0);
00229           }
00230         }
00231     }
00232   }
00233 
00234   /* process the first stage, which reads Mops from fetch */
00235   if(!core->fetch->Mop_available())
00236   {
00237     stall_reason = DSTALL_EMPTY;
00238   }
00239   else if(occupancy[0] == 0) /* non-serpentine pipe; only decode if first stage is empty */
00240   {
00241     int Mops_decoded = 0;
00242     for(i=0;(i<knobs->decode.width) && core->fetch->Mop_available();i++)
00243     {
00244       if(pipe[0][i] == NULL) /* decoder available */
00245       {
00246         struct Mop_t * fetch_Mop = core->fetch->Mop_peek();
00247 
00248         /* consume the Mop from fetch */
00249         pipe[0][i] = fetch_Mop;
00250         occupancy[0]++;
00251         zesto_assert(occupancy[0] <= knobs->decode.width,(void)0);
00252         core->fetch->Mop_consume();
00253         Mops_decoded++;
00254       }
00255     }
00256     if(Mops_decoded == 0)
00257       stall_reason = DSTALL_FULL;
00258   }
00259 
00260   ZESTO_STAT(stat_add_sample(core->stat.decode_stall, (int)stall_reason);)
00261 }
00262 
00263 void
00264 core_decode_STM_t::recover(struct Mop_t * const Mop)
00265 {
00266   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
00267   /* walk pipe from youngest uop blowing everything away,
00268      stop if we encounter the recover-Mop */
00269   for(int stage=0;stage<knobs->decode.depth;stage++)
00270   {
00271     if(occupancy[stage])
00272       for(int i=knobs->decode.width-1;i>=0;i--)
00273       {
00274         if(pipe[stage][i])
00275         {
00276           if(pipe[stage][i] == Mop)
00277             return;
00278           else
00279           {
00280             pipe[stage][i] = NULL;
00281             occupancy[stage]--;
00282             zesto_assert(occupancy[stage] >= 0,(void)0);
00283           }
00284         }
00285       }
00286   }
00287 }
00288 
00289 /* same as above, but blow away the entire decode pipeline */
00290 void
00291 core_decode_STM_t::recover(void)
00292 {
00293   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
00294   for(int stage=0;stage<knobs->decode.depth;stage++)
00295   {
00296     if(occupancy[stage])
00297       for(int i=knobs->decode.width-1;i>=0;i--)
00298       {
00299         if(pipe[stage][i])
00300         {
00301           pipe[stage][i] = NULL;
00302           occupancy[stage]--;
00303           zesto_assert(occupancy[stage] >= 0,(void)0);
00304         }
00305       }
00306   }
00307 }

00312 
00313 bool core_decode_STM_t::uop_available(void)
00314 {
00315   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
00316   int stage = knobs->decode.depth-1;
00317   return occupancy[stage] != 0; /* if last stage is not empty, a uop is available */
00318 }
00319 
00320 struct uop_t * core_decode_STM_t::uop_peek(void)
00321 {
00322   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
00323   struct uop_t * uop = NULL;
00324   int stage = knobs->decode.depth-1;
00325 
00326 
00327   /* assumes uop_available has already been called */
00328   for(int i=0;i<knobs->decode.width;i++)
00329   {
00330     if(pipe[stage][i])
00331     {
00332       struct Mop_t * Mop = pipe[stage][i];      /* Mop in current decoder */
00333       uop = &Mop->uop[Mop->decode.last_stage_index]; /* first non-queued uop */
00334       
00335       zesto_assert((!(uop->decode.opflags & F_STORE)) || uop->decode.is_std,NULL);
00336       zesto_assert((!(uop->decode.opflags & F_LOAD)) || uop->decode.is_load,NULL);
00337 
00338       uop->decode.Mop_seq = Mop->oracle.seq;
00339       uop->decode.uop_seq = (Mop->oracle.seq << UOP_SEQ_SHIFT) + uop->flow_index;
00340 
00341       zesto_assert(uop != NULL,NULL);
00342       return uop;
00343     }
00344   }
00345 
00346   fatal("should have been able to provide a uop, but none were found in decode");
00347 
00348 }
00349 
00350 void core_decode_STM_t::uop_consume(void)
00351 {
00352   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
00353   struct uop_t * uop = NULL;
00354   int stage = knobs->decode.depth-1;
00355 
00356   /* assumes uop_available has already been called */
00357   for(int i=0;i<knobs->decode.width;i++)
00358   {
00359     if(pipe[stage][i])
00360     {
00361       struct Mop_t * Mop = pipe[stage][i];      /* Mop in current decoder */
00362       uop = &Mop->uop[Mop->decode.last_stage_index]; /* first non-queued uop */
00363       Mop->decode.last_stage_index += uop->decode.has_imm ? 3 : 1;  /* increment the uop pointer to next uop */
00364       
00365       ZESTO_STAT(core->stat.decode_uops++;)
00366       uop->timing.when_decoded = sim_cycle;
00367       if(uop->decode.BOM)
00368         uop->Mop->timing.when_decode_started = sim_cycle;
00369       if(uop->decode.EOM)
00370         uop->Mop->timing.when_decode_finished = sim_cycle;
00371 
00372       if(Mop->decode.last_stage_index >= Mop->decode.flow_length)
00373       {
00374         if(Mop->uop[Mop->decode.last_uop_index].decode.EOM)
00375           ZESTO_STAT(core->stat.decode_insn++;)
00376         /* all uops dispatched, remove from decoder */
00377         pipe[stage][i] = NULL;
00378         occupancy[stage]--;
00379         zesto_assert(occupancy[stage] >= 0,(void)0);
00380       }
00381 
00382       zesto_assert(uop != NULL,(void)0);
00383       return;
00384     }
00385   }
00386 
00387   fatal("should have been able to provide a uop, but none were found in decode");
00388 
00389 }
